Ok nice to see that Starbucks is a global shit show Heres what happened today in my store in Germany you cant make this shit up On Friday evening my state announced that all restaurants will be closed due to Covid19 A couple of days earlier Amrest sent out a FAQ mail which clearly stated that Starbucks is considered a restaurant There was a point before that where it wasnt clear if the Bux was considered retail or food service industry and it was important to know because of the frequently updated bans and shutdowns made by the state I met up today with my SM and another barista to take inventory and prep the store to close for the unforeseeable future when around 11 am we got a call that other coffee chains were still open downtown and we had about an hour to open ours again too I dont know if its a legit loophole but Amrest claims that since were only doing takeout came in effect only today lol were not a regular restaurant and therefore allowed to operate That the Bux doesnt care isnt anything new we shouldve closed a while ago not only for the customers safety but for ours too But the couple hours where it was announced that were closed and Amrest wants to ensure 90 of payment instead of 60 were a real pleasant surprise I really feel like BooBoo The Fool for believing that they actually care lol As soon as it was known that others were still open and the Bux can have a slice of that money cake they grabbed that opportunity and flipped us off Now other SMs are telling us to be reasonable and grateful that we still have a job Im sorry Maam but that sounds fucked up Were dealing with a pandemic
Thirty days paid is nice and all but what happens after those 30 days are over and the virus is still here Starbucks wont keep paying us forever were all getting laid off arent we

UPDATE Im a shift supervisor at Starbucks and have worked there for about a year and a half I requested to take the 30 days off My reasoning was that I am a clarinet major in college and the virus attacks the lungs If the virus were to damage my lungs permanently I would have to change career paths I know its not a super intense reason but it was my reasoning Corporate claimed I didnt meet a required standard and therefore would NOT be paid for my 30 days off but I could still choose to not work for 30 days I of course asked what the standards were and my manager responded saying even she didnt know the standards Dont expect to get paid everyone Starbucks has chosen to stay greedy during a national crisis

Yes I am incredibly thankful for the 1 month of paid time at home Yes Im incredibly thankful for the extra 3hour through may Im very thankful that I still have my job and that my company is trying But this doesnt mean that my notsohappy feelings about Starbucks are invalid We are officially back to work on May 4th I believe we are open to the public on the 5th I love my bosses I love my fellow shifts I love my baristas and I am so broken up about us going back to work so soon While we will be DTonly wearing masks etc but COVID19 hasnt even peaked in our state yet While it was amazing to have that month of social distancing that surely helped a lot of people but the surge of COVID19 in our area is predicted in midMay or even midJune In our state and county Starbucks meets the criteria for essential businesses so we can legally be open Social distancing and stay at home measures are not being enforced Our numbers looked better when there was enough fear to keep people at home but earlier in the month many people decided that the risk was low enough that they could resume life as normal which is of course putting themselves and everyone else at high risk So what happens when COVID19 inevitably hits our community hard and 35 of us are still coming into contact daily with each other and with the public How many of us will get sick I know that I can use my sick and vacation time but its not like I have months saved up only a few days I know that I can apply for a leave of absence but I cant not get paid I dont qualify for the stimulus check I know that at the end of the day Starbucks is a business that has to be open to function But at what cost We have already used our one month and the worst is yet to come Will they let us close again or do we just have to suck it up Im scared for me Im scared for my coworkers and my community Ive thought about writing a letter to corporate but what can I even say Its not like I have a solution either I guess if nothing else this qualifies as a rantcry for help Even if you can only commiserate I appreciate any input I can get Im just feeling dejected and disheartened I dont know where to go from here

How did your stores react to the 30 days PTO news My partners and I almost all consider each other friends We have a group chat where we talk just for fun pretty much When we all received the notification about the possibility of 30 days of pay we all hopped on a group call and talked for almost two hours Almost all of us lived with high risk family members and dreaded going to work This opportunity was what we had been waiting for At first there was confusion in the call what does this mean How does this work Huh Then it was should we ask our manager right now To avoid flooding our manager with the same question one of us contacted him about the notification He responded saying he would be having a conference call at 930 pm and would get back to us when it finished up Together we decided to at least let him know that we all were interested pending the details Once our manager got out of his conference call he texted us one by one He told us we can start our 30 days tomorrow Saturday at the time Sunday or Monday We sat there for about an hour deciding what our next move would be When would our last day be for the betterment of our store and to ensure no one feels abandoned We contacted the manager with the proposal to move clean play up to Saturday to ensure it gets done this week and most decided Sunday would be our last day I feel fortunate that my partners and I worked through the somewhat confusing two hours together and came up with a good game plan Im a bit sad though to see other partners have had nowhere near the same experience Some even feel guilty for taking the time off Is my store just weird in that we all said yes to this PTO I dont think anyone should feel guilty for taking this opportunity And I feel horrible for any partner who feels pressured to turn it down

Have you considered getting an antibody test when it becomes available It is possible that you had COVID19 but depending on when you had symptoms the testing protocols may had said test for flu or consider other illnesses diseases or conditions first I ran into this issue with getting tested when I did have a variety of symptoms that could had been from having COVID19 or being exposed to SARSCoV2 While the antibody test does not guarantee immunity nor indicate that you can not acquire the virus again it does provide information in how you handled exposure symptoms recovery And also may help to consider how to handle a secondary exposure Also start thinking about how you would be able to provide a list of contacts for tracing if you do test positive which I hope you do notstay as safe as possible in the future I had not thought through how I would handle the contact tracing if I tested positive and I started to stress about it once I was able to get tested This virus hit the world so fast in terms of proving lack of preparedness that I would not be surprised if a lot of people have not already been exposed andor acquired the virus Good luck stay safe as possible and hang in there

Being on a leave of asbence still allows you to continue to participate in SCAP but the LOA doesnt 100 protect your eligibility SCAP eligibility is dependent on your 2 biannual BEN audits that occur in Jan and July To maintain your eligbility for the next period you will need to meet the July 5th audit of 450 hrs lowered from 520 Jan audit maintains eligibility for April May June July August September July audit maintains eligibility for October November December January February March If you do not meet your July audit you will lose your benefits eligibilty on Sept 30th If you log into mysbuxben or mypartnerinfo for paystubs you can find your current BEN hours to see if youve already met your audit amount or if you still need to more hours LOA guarantees 20hrs minimum per week that will be put towards the current ben audit period June 15th July 5th put towards your July audit with July 6th Sept 30 LOA weeks would be put towards the Jan audit Edit Some things to note about LOA from the benefits plan description Pay while on a leave of absence All leaves of absence are unpaid however certain pay replacement options may be available or required depending on the type of leave you are on Sick Time while on leave You may substitute any available sick time when not receiving Short Term Disability pay Sick time is not available when taking Military Personal or Career Coffee Break sabbatical leave and as detailed below on the chart A partner eligible for Short Term Disability pay may be eligible to receive partial reimbursement of lost wages if taking leave due to his or her own serious health condition See the Short Term Disability chapter for more information and refer to the chart below If you are receiving Short Term Disability pay you are not eligible to use available sick time or vacation pay Vacation Pay while on leave You are only required to substitute available vacation if you are on Career Coffee Break leave You may choose to use available vacation pay during any other leave when not receiving Short Term Disability STD Parental Leave Pay or sick time

Whether you receive Unemployment Insurance benefits and how much youre entitled to each week depends on how much you earned during your base period All states have similar wage requirements which are determined by the laws in each state To qualify for benefits in Arizona you must have worked for an employer who paid unemployment tax and you must have earned At least 390 times the Arizona minimum wage in your highest earning quarter and the total of the other three quarters must equal at least one half of the amount in your high quarter For example if you made 5000 in your highest quarter you need to have earned a total of 2500 within the remaining three quarters combined Or at least 7000 in total wages in at least two quarters of the base period with wages in one quarter equal to 598750 or more Unfortunately the document doesnt show that for the summaries that theyre examples taken from UI agency websites

11th is SM conduct 11 separation convos 15th is for LOA effective date Q When can I expect my last paycheck for the remaining hours Im scheduled for that week of separation A If partners are on the schedule the week they are separated from the company Starbucks will pay partners for their scheduled hours These hours will be included with your final paycheck Your final pay will be issued on the next regularly scheduled payday following your employment separation or sooner if required by state law In addition your final pay stub will be mailed directly to your home address on file as you will no longer have access to My Partner Info MPI If you do not have direct deposit your pay will be mailed to your home address All applicable deductions such as health care premiums will be applied to your final paycheck If you need copies of other pay stubs please contact the Partner Contact Center at 866 5047368

Log into mysbuxben how many BEN hours do you have right now Typically LOA gives partners 20hrs per work towards BEN While you are on an approved leave you may be given credit of up to 20 hours per week during your leave to the maximum number of weeks described on the next page These hours will count towards the eligibility requirement and will be reflected as LOA Leave of Absence hours on your pay statement Your BEN Benefit hours plus your LOA hours must total at least 520 for the 6month measurement period to pass the semiannual audit and maintain your benefits eligibility If you have over 450 BEN hours for the July audit then you will maintain your benefits eligibility for the months of October November December January February and March

Hm okay forgive me since the only time I did UI w severance was in 2013 and there were no forms required for the state I was in at the time Q When can I expect my Separation payment A Documents in your separation packet will include details regarding separation pay with an explanation of when you can expect to receive your payment If you return your Release Agreement within a timely manner you can expect to receive your separation payment within two regular pay periods of the agreements effective date The method of payment will be in the form in which you typically received your regular pay ie direct deposit check etc Please note that in some states separation pay will be included in your weekly income to determine your unemployment benefits for that week While the Federal Pandemic Unemployment Compensation FPUC program is in effect until the end of July individuals receiving at least 1 in state unemployment compensation in a week are eligible for an additional 600 for that week You should check your states unemployment agencys web site to determine the impact of separation pay on weekly benefits It may be in your interest to delay returning your signed separation agreement in order to avoid losing eligibility for the FPUC benefit in one or more weeks Starbucks can not advise you on this issue but we will accept separation agreements returned in August Is your states UI application asking for this form from the employer thats giving you severance I did not take pref 3 so Im not privy to what documentsforms theyve been giving out with it Only that they mentioned the separation agreement which I have no clue what that is

In Seattle for some businesses depending on size you cant have your shift changed by more than 15 minutes without worker approval If they wont change you can require them to work the shift and pay an additional hour of labor for the short notice Refusing a predictability funded change is like refusing a scheduled shift If you get cut early by more than 15 minutes you get an additional hour of pay Realistically nobody I know has been punished for refusing predictability pay to stay Its more a carrot than a stick Seattle also requires a good faith estimate of hours for average hours per specific worker and has protections if that is violated and reported Which is partly why I believe these preferences were even offered Seattle requires notice and consent to reduced average hours

Refusing a predictability funded change is absolutely NOT the same as refusing a scheduled shift It specifically says in the ordinance that the worker can refuse the hours The predictability pay is an incentive Note this applies to extendingadding shifts Obviously if youre sent home you cant demand to stay Edit see A2 A For employerrequested changes to the written work schedule that occur after the advance notice required in Section 1422040 1 The employer shall provide the employee with timely notice of the change by inperson conversation telephone call email text message or other accessible electronic or written format and 2 The employee may decline to work any hours not included in the employees work schedule

The reason retail is considered entrylevel is because it is a job that anybody can get even people with little or no work experience These jobs could lead to career opportunities eg store manager district manager The fact of the matter is more adults than teenagers work in retail I think in my area the average age is late twenties or early thirties That said retail is not a great career path It can take years to become a SM or DM and there arent a lot of DM jobs to begin with While the DM wage is decent lifetime earnings will be lower if you worked your way up You can go to college and earn more than DMs out of school at 21 There are plenty of wellpaying jobs that dont involve sitting at a desk all day You got to hustle and invest in yourself to find a career thatll help achieve your goals If Starbucks isnt getting you there perhaps its time to move on

pretty much any drink you get can be vegan caramel drizzle isnt vegan but caramel syrup is pumpkin sauce and white mocha arent vegan but regular mocha is my location has almond milk coconut milk and oat milk too my suggestion for a lot of caffeine is a venti iced cinnamon dolce latte made with oat milk 4 shots of espresso and its vegan i recommend espresso based iced drinks if you want caffeine but you can add espresso to any drink you could get a mocha frap with 2 shots and oat milk if you want something super sweet 2 shots of espresso and our mocha is vegan if you want to tell me what you like or what youre thinking i can tell you how to make it vegan also all of our teas are caffeinated and vegan if you dont want coffee

If you wan na try cold brew you could get the new dark cocoa almond milk cold foam cold brew I swear the names only get longer or you could get the cinnamon almond milk cold foam cold brew You could get a nondairy milk in the cold brew itself too so it doesnt have such a strong coffee taste
Hi vegan barista here I love getting a venti toffee nut cold brew with oatmilk Lots of caffeine
Iced coffee with blonde shots add white mocha and oatmilk for something mild and refreshing lots of caffeine too
Do you add anything to your cold brew or can you add milksyrups to it I like something that tastes sweet or chocolatey
If you do decide to get the Cinnamon Dolce Latte ask for no Cinnamon Dolce Topping It has dairy in it
White mocha isnt vegan unfortunately
you could try adding some pumps of mocha and coconut milk which acts like a creamer compared to the other nondairy milks

Im a SSV Our manager has been very vocal about how they think COVID is being way overblown and its all ridiculous That made partners feel uncomfortable and that their worries werent going to be taken seriously So 1 watch what you say around your team and make sure they feel comfortable being honest with you Also they take everything personally Someone calls in sick Instant bad mood and its taken out of everyone on the floor Someone puts in their two weeks She gives them the cold shoulder and doesnt ask why So 2 dont make yourself the focus If you stay calm so will they Basically we have a huge problem at our store because everyone is scared of our manager because she will flip out at the smallest thing When peak hits its not how can we help the customer its what does the manager need Everyone caters to her A great manager is one that supports their team not the other way around The fact that youre asking this shows you care and I think youll do great

Best advice if your goal is to enhance the Partner experience is to keep their biggest challenges in mind Regardless if management or location of your store each and every one of your Partners is underpaid and working in stores with nowhere near enough labor to support the ever growing expectations from the company Keep the above in mind with every conversation you have with Partners and especially when you have to coach for tasks not getting done Youll do just fine

Communication Make sure youre taking time to touch base with your shifts and see what kinds of experiences they and the baristas are going through so you have an understanding of what store morale is likesomething thats very important in the current climate Also make sure that if a shift isnt able to come to a shift meeting that you take the time to connect with them and relay info from the shift meeting instead of them having to get the info from the other shifts

I think communication and listening is most important from my leader Sometimes I just need you to listen to me whine about how annoying something is Sometimes I need you to listen to me when I tell you that this person isnt a great fit for us and these are the reasons why Also just telling people whats going on in the store helps keep them more involved and makes you feel like youre part of things Things that are detrimental for me is feeling like my SM doesnt care if I struggle or appreciate me I know we are all over worked and underpaid but all that is a little less crappy when my SM regularly tells me that he thinks Im doing a great job and that he appreciates my efforts in the store also he always says call me if you need anything as hes leaving Its kind of obvious and maybe a little insincere since he always says it but also I kind of love it because it means that even if he isnt in the store with me hes still got my back Also writing great schedules super helps Plus finding coverage when call outs happen is awesome Fixing my problems before they are my problems Yes please Also just little things Someone was an hour late to their shift it was the middle of peak and I was on drive bar on admin day Instead of letting everything struggledie my SM stopped admin work for 2 minutes to check my late partner in so we could keep pushing drinks out He didnt have to it oh man did that little action help so much

With a properly functioning windscreen turned on which is a requirement nonetheless Enough pressure is pushed out that window that its going to be near impossible for any droplets to make it into the building This has been posted by Starbucks and many of the major Healthy and Safety organizations You are more likely to pass droplets to them as the pressure goes out and down Even without the windscreen on The passive airflow in the building and the opening of your front entrance should still create a significant draft out Face shields are allowed already and will be available to order in October for DTW partners As for anybody who gets snow Your window will be closed with the heater on in just a few weeks So its one less thing you dont have to worry about The face shield will be the same protection as a plexiglass partition The only real areas of contact are moneydebitcredit terminal and handing out product Terminal can be cleaned after each use if they dont have Tap with single use Red Sani Cloths typical in Clover stores or you are allowed to have a bin the same that goes under your espresso bar with sani solution and a cloth Just make sure its not soaked or you will fry the terminals screen security lock Hand sanitizer should be there for change And you can use any wire basket to hand items out if you dont want to physically hold them
Your window will be closed with a heater lol nope We have to connect even in winter but thanks for the heads up about the face shields those should help

Its a public health and safety violation If its 15 to 35 and with a windchill hitting almost 45 degrees Celsius We are allowed to close the window This was in a communication at some point over the last 3 years Most drivers already roll their windows back up Its a loss of heat for your store It could hurt your DTW person since they cant have gloves which also means rotating positions need to be much more frequent It was also suggested to keep it open Yes But not that it had to be for indoor seating it becomes unbearably cold Same with partners And if I have to go do my own warming or my own CloverPour over turn around to make iced drinks Im going to be closing that window There is zero rule that states it has to be left open So what if you lose some connection stores Earn them back on nailing a perfect speaker box order taking going fast efficient and giving out the right drinks Seal the deal when you hand everything off to them Of course you can still talk if you want but its not required Your health is more important Especially when it comes to frost bite Fight the bottles that count Im sure a face shield and a plexiglass will fog up wonderfully with a required mask to still be worn under it Explain the situation to your SM and DM Talk with PCC Yes try and engage when you can But Id thats not possible Close the window It makes it better for everybody else Having an SM on your side is far more beneficial

Starbucks has an ethics statement that you can access from the partner hub that lays out the ethical standards they hold their suppliers to Since we cant post internal documents Ill describe the steps to get there Log into the Partner Hub On the main page under one of the submenus there is a section about Ethical Sourcing Click on the one that reads Manufactured Goods In the section entitled What Are Our Standards there is a PDF Click on that That takes you to a 4page document entitled Starbucks Supplier Social Responsibility Standards Manufactured Goods and Services TBH as someone who has a deep knowledge of the prison system of the United States I found the language a little unsettling and squirrelly especially around the issue of prison labor Starbucks has used US prison labor in the past to produce holiday items and when asked about it today defaults to the language in this document that Starbucks will not tolerate the use of any forced or involuntary labor either directly or indirectly by our suppliers contractors or subcontractors This includes the use of slave labor bonded labor indentured labor or involuntary convict labor But the problem is that most jobs in jails and prisons while voluntary on paper are highly coerced In many you are required to hold a job and are punished if you dont And even the ones where its isnt strictly required if you choose not to take one you are disproportionately targeted for abuse and harassment by COs Your stay is harder You dont earn as much good time credit Holding a job in prison is seen as a sign of reform and responsibility at parole hearings not holding one is seen almost as if the person is just one step away from falling right back into a life of crime My point is you cant truly call prison labor voluntary And I think Starbucks knows that And my gut tells me they still use prison labor but its okay because the inmates said they were cool with it guys right That makes it okay Its a special job that paid a few more dollars and got the prisoners a few extra perks So they had them sign an NDA and a contract saying they were voluntary signing up for this job and added then word involuntary before prison labor because corporatespeak

Well theyre partnered with Nestle which is well known for relying on child labor among other heinous business practices Ive read a couple places that a lot of the whole bean packaging in the US is done by prisoners but I cant remember where exactly And I have no proof of this at all but Ive suspected for a long time that they use prison call centers to staff the facilities contact center I cant put my finger on it but after being a shift for over 10 years my gut just tells me every time I have to call the FCC that the women Im talking to are in a prison call center job

This is a really good starting point in terms of looking for red flags and you certainly found one But honestly the problem doesnt have an easy solution The question does Starbucks use ethical labor can only be answered one of two ways 1 Finding proof that they use unethical labor at any given point in the supply chain 2 Examining each and every step of the supply chain for every single product Obviously given the scale and complexity of the Starbucks operation 2 isnt viable Which means were essentially left trying to prove a negative Personally I find a policy document entirely inadequate to prove anything Thats just their official stance To develop confidence that this policy is being upheld I think wed need to look for the internal checking processes and enforcement methods
But China is also known for childslave labor Theres just no official statement or anything stating specifically that they dont use child slave or prison labor

Search the Partner Hub for Intelligent Hub App Quick Reference Guide Its viewable on non corporate devices as well Cant post photos of it here as its still an internal document Theyve simplified it since it first came out Its a few steps and your done As others will say you can also access it online here No the app doesnt track you or use your information Otherwise they wouldnt be allowed to use it You can use whatever one is more comfortable and easier for you There will be many against the app stating privacy reasons which are simply not accurate Secondly The app is far more accessible for individuals to view Their website is 100 not useable for partners who use accommodation and accessibility features on their phones

No manager needed All the information is on the Partner Hub available in store or at Home Its a 3 step process now Less than 15 pages of reading Name also has been changed to Starbucks Partner Hours downloaded through the AppCafe through VMware Starbucks has done a really good job at improving the clarity and options of the app Initially at first it was confusing but much much less now but they havent really pushed it since the first update or the name change So less people know and just remember it being complicated But for sure a Manager can help need be if something arises

Im assuming Android Double check Also use the search feature and look up SBUXPartnerHrs manually and see if it shows If you are on android It might have installed to another user profile Try searching your phones app by the search bar Whether you try Starbucks or SBUXPartnerHrs It might have installed in a Holden area that happened to somebody using an android on my floor But once they found it there They could click and it fully activate everything properly You can always remove the apps remove the profile And start fresh Make sure you reboot the phone before and after adding or removing the profile Sometimes things get left behind and cause issues After that PCC would probably be the best place for a quick run through thats low tailored to to

You 100 followed the steps when Installing the Profile on iOS settings Home Screen Settings General Profile It should say Workplace Services Under Apps how many does it show Does it include SBUXPartnerHrs Another option On the Hub app Click This Device Sync Device Open AppCafe and see if anything is there If not Restart your phone And wait See if it pops up tomorrow Theres not much else you can do other than wait for the request to download it as If that doesnt work Remove and try again for sure Something just have went wrong at some point Who knows But I hope you get it figured out It will probably be something really simple P

Just enjoy it or develop an acquired taste for black coffee Even if we could tell you how much sustenance each type of pump provides there is no rigidity with a handmade drink The frap base pumps get sticky and dont return all the way so someone adds half a pump The vanilla runs out halfway through pumping it same thing Or did someone pour more foamless milk Whip cream or drizzle too Did the person who made the whip shake it properly or is your drink going to get a splatter of unwhipped heavy cream and sugar We dont make drinks or sauces with food scales or measuring cups like I would at home when I was counting calories and restricting What you could do and how I tracked restaurant calories is go by the official nutrition info if youre subtracting calories and add like 50 per everything for adding syrupdrizzleextra whip Or log the venti calories but order a grande which gives you like 50100 cals depending on the drink to add on customizations

If you go to the Contact Us page on the Starbucks website one of the options is Nutritional Information You can email your drinks with modifications and someone will email you back with the nutritional information

First of all CONGRATULATIONS You can always get decaf of any espresso based latte We have a couple herbal options for hot tea and one herbal iced tea Please know that our refreshers are heavily caffeinated and most people are not aware that they are

I see a lot of decaf espresso ideas but I want you to be aware our decaf espresso is not completely caffeine free There is still a tiny bit in it I know some are okay with a little caffeine and some dont like to have any caffeine while pregnant so I wanted to give the heads up Caramel apple spice is a nice fall drink to try It is Steamed apple juice with cinnamon dolce syrup whipped cream and caramel drizzle
decaf iced americano with pumpkin cream cold foam

Caramel apple spice Its steamed apple juice with cinnamon dolce syrup whipped cream and caramel drizzle You could also do decaf espresso in any of our drinks Theres also hot chocolate or a steamer steamed milk with whatever syrup you want

ASU will definitely be cheaper and their online program is designed specifically to be online so youll also have an easier time learning and stuff than other students on at nononline colleges Also yes FAFSA has to be filled out in order to qualify for the SCAP benefit even if you dont get anything from the government

Are you asking about what the ASU online experience is like compared to traditional college Ive done both Im currently a junior at ASU and I went to a 4 yr school but dropped out after my freshman year It wasnt for me The online thing has been really wonderful because I do it when I have time I work about 27 hours a week on average and have a child and I still have plenty of time to do school Yes you 100 have to do the fafsa its a pain but its necessary Yes there are disability services at ASU A professor suggested I contact them last semester when I had to check into a mental health hospital and I havent yet but apparently even depression and anxiety is worth having on the record They were very accommodating though and I got all my finals postponed several weeks so I could catch up and I kept a 41 gpa

I knew ASU would be a great option for me because I didnt want to juggle a work schedule with an oncampus schedule My classes would have been all over the place if I went oncampus so it was a nobrainer for me to go with ASU instead You do have to fill out a FAFSA but you do not need to be eligible to receive funds so youll need to do that portion of the ASU SCAP application Its just a requirement in the chance that you CAN receive aid that way first then they want that to be utilized to minimize the amount youd pay out of pocket Disability services

Sometimes the fat from the heavy cream is in one pitcher more than the others We make it in one huge batch and then split it later into 4 pitchers The fat sits on top sometimes when it sits for more than like 6hrs So if you dont mix the big batch before splitting it after it was made 6 hours ago then the fat wont be distributed evenly when poured and the pitcher with less fat wont foam up as well

Ive been working at Starbucks for amonth or so and the biggest piece of advice I can give you is ASK QUESTIONS No matter how stupid or annoying it may seem just ask And study the recipes It will help tremendously

Also recognize that your training never ends Ive been a partner for two years and I learn new things every week Itll take time to catch on to the Starbucks ways so be patient with yourself Introduce yourself if you feel comfortable or ask your trainer to point out who all you are working with each day Knowing names and faces can help when you need to ask questions Have fun Honestly I realize its just a job sometimes but have fun at work Laugh with your partners enjoy making drinks and try to stay positive during these really trying times Good luck and have a great first day

Never make whipped cream without a white rubber seal Dont mix up floor cleaner and dishwasher soap If a customer is nasty to you just silently stare them dead in the eye and let them exhaust themself It works wonders In all seriousness congrats Re tips there is no such thing as a stupid question and take everything in stride Get a good pair of nonslip shoes and the world is your oyster

One way to remove the gap without going past the splash amount of 2 milk using the following methodology Pull shots into shot glass Pump required number of shots into shaker add correct volumetric scoop of ice sequence out to next drink if necessary Pour shots into shaker shake The hot espresso will melt some ice but you will still be short on liquid despite the foam appearing to make it full the gap Pour contents into customers cup Fill cup with more ice through the foam until you can see the new ice level with the rim of cup Add the splash of 2 milk The splash will fill between the ice and squish some foam while ultimately filling to the top of the cup As the drink sits for the mobile customer the ice will melt a bit further into liquid water form and the foam will dissipate However the liquid level near the top of the cup will be maintained so you can leave the drink No more gap
Starbucks Double Shot on Ice shouldnt be filled to the top Theres only a splash of milk added standard
Theres always going to be a gap The shaker is only supposed to be filled with ice to the size line The espresso poured on top will melt some of the ice

Press Ristretto or Long if you need those sorts of shots then the number of shots you want Ristretto shots only pull in twos so if you do something like a grande flat white the second set of shots will need the cup moved over to only catch half the espresso Mastrena 1s got a handle for the steam wand so pull that all the way down for automatic steaming about halfway for manual steaming and theres a and button on the display if you need the milk steamed extra hot or warm Mastrena 1s only have two hoppers so there will be a decaf machine and the other one will be for blonde Both can also pull regular espresso On the blonde machine youll hit the decaf button for shots because the blonde beans go in the decaf hopper If your shots pull too slow theres a knob to adjust grind It should Tell you when you need to do it Pull three sets of double shots after turning the knob to give it time to calibrate If you have any questions just ask Im off work in a couple of hours so I can answer more then Got ta hop back on the floor

I mean you are well within your rights to lock your till thats on you when you leave for the day you can always go ahead an unassigned yourself as needed if you get push back from SSVs about it talk to your manager

Till audits will be coming Man it sounds like your manager wasnt doing their job and got chewed out by their dm during a recent ppv visit where they looked at the pl and discovered a larger discrepancy in cash shortage than usual Your manager wont be able to do retroactive till audits But I imagine the statement was meant more so as a going forward type of statement though the reality is that they should have been doing this all along as it has been pointed out at least twice a week But yeah it just takes time building the habit of logging out of your till when going on break or leaving for the day but thats really all you need to do As long as you havent been mismanaging money then you dont have anything to worry about They do also have cameras pointed at every single register Ive seen a few partners get separated for stealing money sometimes not even on their own till and in each instance Starbucks made sure to go through the camera footage so they knew since that way that partner couldnt come back and say well my manager just counted wrong and didnt do the audit correctly or something like that

A till audit happens whenever an SM counts down a till SMs are supposed to do at least 2 per week to check to make sure everyone is being accurate with money and ringing things up As long as the till is within 5 or 5 then everything is ok So long as there isnt a pattern of consistently being short 5 Protect yourself make sure you lock your till whenever you step away even briefly If someone insists that you share your till you can and should refuse and report that to the SM or partner resources Never ring on someone elses till Official policy is still no till sharing if business is slow you may only be using the left or the right side but you can still use both the top and bottom to avoid sharing

There is nothing you can do directly to incentivise the company simply doesnt give us the resources to do that outside of the occasional couple large pizzas after a decent DT week But what you can do is offer support and coaching Ask whats on their mind Find out what is important to them about this job and what obstacles they are facing during their shifts Sometimes just talking these problems out is a help already but often this discourse can help the team brainstorm solutions together rather than waiting for your leaders to fix it Youll also find that affirmation and support in the moment can also be very impactful on the Partner experience in that shift Hey uwkuta bud you are killing it on bar today youve stayed in routine and managed to keep the area clean Im impressed What can I do to help you keep it up

Not to be a downer but theres really nothing you can do Were being worked to the bone more and more is being demanded of us while we feel less and less valued as employees Even SMs arent really going to be able to drive up partner motivation when whats killing us is too little staffing too little pay too little protection You arent going to be able to fix those things Just be genuine be kind be understanding If youre asking how to get partners to motivate each other I recommend not doing that Were all doing enough emotional labor for ourselves and our families Dont ask people to be responsible for each other at work as well Most of us no longer have the ability were all basically in survival mode

There is no paid medical leave There is family leave which is paid but youll be required to use vacation and sick time to supplement your income on medical leave I believe your other option would be to file for disability

Well if my pain has been bad to the point of feeling like I was going to pass out How long is medical leave

So looking at the Benefits PDF which you can find on Partner Hub youll only be approved for Medical Leave if youre also approved for Short Term Disability It says that your Medical Leave will be approved for as long as youre approved for the Short Term Disability with a maximum of 26 weeks So I was right and wrong There is no paid medical leave but there is a medical leave that is automatically supplemented with pay from disability

1 Questions about what you know about Starbucks and the founder Usually tell me about a time questions where you had to deal with a conflict at work you provided exceptional customer service for this you can use an example from your job and just state you were serving an internal customer like your boss or the theatre customers or use your problem solving skills Hypotheticals like how would you handle an angry customer apologize ask what you can do to make the moment right remake the drink or offer to treat them to their next one with a recovery card or a really busy store focus on maintaining standards while working quickly to minimize the wait thank customers for their patience and use their long wait times to make customer connectionsyou can also emphasize that you are calm under pressure and enjoy the energy of a busy workplace 2 One of the best ways to show youre good for customer service is just through your personality and demeanour Smile be friendly to everyone eg when you show up and let the barista at the register know youre here for an interview start with Hi how are you etc You can state that you are looking for something customerfacing because you enjoy interacting with people and making their day brighter with a special drink Something about how Starbucks is known for going above and beyond to make our guests feel welcome and it means a lot to you that everyone who comes in leaves feeling happier than they were before Stuff like that 3 Black pants and a buttondown shirt maybe with a sweater over it if the weather permits That always looks nice without looking too dressy Try to spend some time practicing your answers to common questions like I listed above so you arent caught offguard Mostly just relax and be positive they arent looking for tons of experience just a good attitude and someone who seems willing to learn Good luck

Be outgoing and show them that you are a people person Use your theater experience to emphasize how well you are at teamworksupporting other coworkers to get the job done Let them know you consider yourself a leader and are reliable If asked why you want to work for Starbucks tell them youve heard the company provides great benefits helps develop skills for promotions and that you enjoy the coffeehouse experience that Starbucks provides to its community Both my hiring interview and promotion interview have been super relaxed and chill No need to be nervous Also you dont need any coffee experience or knowledge prior to getting hired so dont lie lol

Weve used an accordion folder before Good for keeping it organized with everyones names in the same spot
a notebook with plastic sleeves that has their name written on the front theyre always in the same order

My store uses a pencil case We have separate ones for current tips previous tips not picked up and tips for partners from other stores Each individual person has there tips in one of the red tip bags with there name and the amount on the front We each have to initial for our tips on the tip report

We use the brown pound of coffee bags Plenty of room for ones we write whats being put in on every tip day and its super easy to reorder them when we get a new partner They just live in a handle bag in the safe
We have an alphabetical accordian folder and put each partners tips in the long wrap style warming bags w their names on it Makes it easy to replace or reshuffle as you add or renove partners

We have one of those hanging shoe organizer things hanging in our back room that everyone has a dedicated pocket in we use pastry bags for tips and store them in there with whatever else people want to leave in their pockets
